a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Based on mined, rather than refinedยน, production. Measured in tonnes.
Data source: BGS - World Mineral Statistics (2023)
Note: Values are reported as tonnes of metal content.
1. Refined production: Refined production is the process of taking raw materials, such as metals extracted from ores, and purifying them to achieve
a higher quality or more usable form. After metals are initially extracted from ore through processes like smelting, they often contain impurities or are
not in the ideal form for manufacturing. Refining involves further processing these metals to remove impurities and adjust their composition to meet
specific standards. Refined production is essential for transforming raw materials into high-quality metals that are crucial for industries and
consumers, from manufacturing electronics to constructing buildings.
